user.title: Connect to NRGkick
user.description:
Enter the connection details for your NRGkick device.

Username and password are only required if BasicAuth is enabled in the NRGkick mobile app (Extended → Local API → Authentication (JSON)).

For setup instructions, see: https://github.com/andijakl/nrgkick-homeassistant#configuration

data_description.username: Only needed if BasicAuth is enabled on the device
data_description.password: Only needed if BasicAuth is enabled on the device

zeroconf_confirm.title: Discovered NRGkick: {name}
zeroconf_confirm.description:
A NRGkick device was discovered on your network.

Username and password are only required if BasicAuth is enabled in the NRGkick mobile app (Extended → Local API → Authentication (JSON)). Leave empty if BasicAuth is not enabled.

For more information, see: https://github.com/andijakl/nrgkick-homeassistant#configuration

data_description.username: Only needed if BasicAuth is enabled on the device
data_description.password: Only needed if BasicAuth is enabled on the device

reauth_confirm.title: Reauthenticate NRGkick
reauth_confirm.description:
The authentication failed. Please verify your credentials.

Credentials are configured in the NRGkick mobile app: Extended → Local API → Authentication (JSON).

For troubleshooting, see: https://github.com/andijakl/nrgkick-homeassistant#troubleshooting

data_description.username: Username configured in the NRGkick mobile app
data_description.password: Password configured in the NRGkick mobile app

error.cannot_connect: Cannot connect to the NRGkick device. Verify: (1) The device is powered on and the LED is active, (2) The IP address is correct (you can ping it from a computer), (3) Home Assistant and the NRGkick are on the same network/VLAN, (4) The JSON API is enabled in the NRGkick app (Extended → Local API → JSON API), (5) No firewall is blocking port 80. Check Home Assistant logs for detailed error messages.
error.invalid_auth: Authentication failed. Verify that: (1) BasicAuth is enabled in the NRGkick app (Extended → Local API → Authentication (JSON)), (2) The username and password match exactly what is configured in the app (case-sensitive), (3) You can access http://{device_ip}/info with these credentials in a browser. If the problem persists, try disabling and re-enabling BasicAuth in the NRGkick app.
error.unknown: An unexpected error occurred during setup. Check the Home Assistant logs (Settings → System → Logs) for detailed error information. Common causes: network issues, device firmware incompatibility, or temporary device unavailability. Try: (1) Restarting the NRGkick device, (2) Verifying network connectivity, (3) Checking the device firmware is up to date.

abort.reauth_failed: Reauthentication failed. Please remove and re-add the integration.
abort.json_api_disabled: The JSON API is not enabled on this NRGkick device. Please enable it in the NRGkick app.
abort.no_serial_number: Could not determine the serial number of the discovered device.

init.title: Reconfigure NRGkick Connection
init.description:
Update the connection details for your NRGkick device. The integration will restart after saving.

Username and password are only required if BasicAuth is enabled in the NRGkick mobile app (Extended → Local API → Authentication (JSON)).

data_description.host: IP address or hostname of your NRGkick device
data_description.username: Only needed if BasicAuth is enabled on the device
data_description.password: Only needed if BasicAuth is enabled on the device
data_description.scan_interval: How often to poll the device for updates (10-300 seconds, default: 30)

error.cannot_connect: Cannot connect to the NRGkick device with the new settings. Please verify: (1) The IP address/hostname is correct and reachable, (2) The JSON API is still enabled on the device, (3) If you changed authentication settings, the credentials match the device configuration. Test the connection using a browser: http://{device_ip}/info
error.invalid_auth: Authentication failed with the new credentials. Ensure that: (1) BasicAuth is enabled in the NRGkick app if you're providing credentials, (2) The username and password match exactly (case-sensitive), (3) You haven't changed the credentials in the app without updating them here. Try accessing http://{device_ip}/info in a browser with these credentials to verify.
error.invalid_scan_interval: Scan interval must be between 10 and 300 seconds. Lower values provide more frequent updates but increase network traffic and device load. The recommended range is 20-60 seconds for most use cases.
error.unknown: An unexpected error occurred while saving the new settings. Check the logs (Settings → System → Logs) for details. The integration was not changed - your previous settings are still active. Common issues: temporary network problems, device busy/rebooting, or firmware issues.
